title: Spotify
notes: Engineer on the Spotify Native Ads Team working with Spark, Scio, Storm, and Google Cloud Platform
Helping conceptualize and implement new ways of understanding the interplay between user happiness, track performance, and artist needs
Building large-scale batch and real-time data pipelines to allow high-quality data consumption for various teams at Spotify

title: Twitter
notes: Engineer on the Twitter Product Analytics team working with Python, Scala, and SQL
Helped Twitter become the largest BigQuery customer on Google Cloud, enabling multi-million dollar savings

Built a high-traffic distributed system to automatically track schema,  permissions, and retention of ~0.2 million tables and several  petabytes worth of company data stored in Twitter’s BigQuery Enterprise Organization

Created a compliance-enforcement application that deleted Twitter-owned BigQuery tables that failed to meet company data safety standards, helping the company keep its data secure and aiding during possible legal audits

title: MongoDB
notes: Engineer on the MongoDB Atlas product working with Java and React

Enabled all ~0.2 million Atlas users worldwide to securely connect to their personal database via an X509 certificate, which is orders of magnitude more secure than the default option of plaintext passwords
Collaborated with UI designers to add features to simplify certificate management for users of Atlas’s web portal

title: Uber
notes: Engineer on the Uber Freight product working with GoLang and React

Built email reminder systems to relay payment updates to all ~0.3 million Uber Freight truck drivers nationwide, improving upon the freight industry’s typical communication delay from > 30 days  to < 24 hours
Collaborated with UI designers to add features to the Uber Freight Operations team’s internal dashboard

title: Pear VC
notes: Member of Pear VC’s Summer 2017 Startup Launchpad Program, where our team successfully raised pre-seed capital and launched a pilot program with paying users
Co-founder of Goodpoint, a platform where users can get professional feedback on important documents
Built the entire web platform from scratch using Node.JS, React, MongoDB, Amazon S3, and Amazon EC2
